title: India leapfrogs China in Israel's biggest port
description: An Indian billionaire now controls 70% of the Israeli port of Haifa, where China recently set up a container terminal.

title: Fighting rages in Sudan despite humanitarian pause
description: Scores have died in an outbreak of violence as residents of Khartoum sheltered in their homes.

title: Behind the French yoga craze lies a labyrinth of training and precarious work
description: In search of physical and spiritual well-being, more young people are training to teach yoga. They're discovering a very competitive job market, far from the idyllic image displayed on social media.

title: Why can inflation generate deep anxieties?
description: Psychoanalyst Claude Halmos draws on reader stories and questions to better understand how the state of the world affects our intimate lives.

title: Where to have lunch in Paris for less than €20? Our (new) selection of 15 spots
description: From Jerusalem artichoke soup to mustardy rabbit, from cactus tacos to plantain burgers, and why not some Japanese and Korean specialties: 15 delicious lunch spots in the French capital with a reasonable price tag.

title: Europe's largest nuclear reactor enters service in Finland after months of delays
description: The Olkiluoto 3 nuclear reactor went into regular production on Sunday, April 16, hours after Germany ended its era of nuclear power.

title: Dozens of prisoners of war freed as Ukraine marks Orthodox Easter
description: Despite the shared Orthodox holiday, Russian shelling and missile attacks continued in Ukraine.

title: Brazil's Lula discusses joint Russia war mediation with China and UAE
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said the two countries and others should join a 'political G20' to try to end the war, and accused the West of prolonging the conflict.

title: Former Indian lawmaker and his brother fatally shot live on TV
description: Atiq Ahmed, accused in several criminal cases, and his brother Ashraf Ahmed were shot dead in Prayagraj by three men who posed as journalists.

title: G7 pledges to quit fossil fuels faster but fails to agree on new deadline
description: This language reflects disagreements in the Group of Seven regarding the balance to strike between climate action and energy security.

title: Bicycle theft in France: A major obstacle to people biking
description: Only 61% of victims buy another bicycle, at a lower price, on average, than the item that was stolen from them, but they invest more in security, according to a study.

title: The end of nuclear power in Germany
description: The last three power plants in operation were disconnected from the grid on Saturday. This ends a 60-year history marked by controversies and divisions.

title: The downfall of Paris' mysterious luxury real estate owner
description: Adrien Labi, who owns numerous lavish buildings in Paris, has been indicted for tax fraud and money laundering. The courts have seized nearly half a billion euros to ensure the payment of his tax debt.

title: French far-right veteran Jean-Marie Le Pen hospitalised
description: The 94-year-old father of current far-right leader Marine Le Pen has suffered several health issues in recent years.

title: Dozens killed in Sudan as army and paramilitaries battle for control
description: A doctors’ group said at least 56 civilians were killed, as fighting between the Sudanese military and rival paramilitary forces continued for a second day on Sunday, April 16.

title: The first time 'Le Monde' wrote 'Playboy'
description: The photos of Minister Marlène Schiappa published in the French edition of 'Playboy' has put the spotlight back on the publication.

title: Smartphones' carbon footprints are largely underestimated
description: Manufacturers are downplaying the environmental impact of their devices, but figures issued by public authorities are also well below reality.

title: Bear populations are consistently rising in the French Pyrenees
description: According to a recent report, 76 bears live in the Pyrenees mountains. Their increasing numbers are overshadowed by a deadly attack in the north of Italy.

title: PKK members in France sentenced to up to five years in prison
description: During the trial of 11 members of the Kurdistan Workers' Party, the defense questioned the terrorist label of this Kurdish organization at war with the Turkish state.

title: An initial assessment of PFAS pollution in France is 'worrying'
description: In a report commissioned in February 2022, the General Inspectorate of the Environment and Sustainable Development highlighted major gaps in the monitoring of these toxic substances.

title: Child psychiatrist Laelia Benoit: 'Anxiety is an inevitable and even healthy response to environmental threats'
description: Child psychiatrist Laelia Benoit discusses eco-anxiety and the impact of climate change on our mental health.

title: Finland erects barrier on its border with Russia
description: The Nordic country – with a population of 5.5 million – hopes to discourage Moscow's attempt to destabilize it through immigration, with a new 3-meter-high fence.
